posts.post_content:
Yeah, the artwork is kind of odd....they made an attempt at forced-perspective to emphasize it's size, and it sort of half-worked. Also, it looks like a giant naked mole rat. Terrifying.
  
   
But this is actually nice. Nothing fancy, just a big cheap fattie. This is what green does. It's probably the only colour that could pull off a 6-mana 8/8 with two abilities. This can never become the norm, of course, but nice once in a blue moon.
posts.html:

Posted By: Eggroll (10/8/2009 12:48:10 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I played a Zendikar tournament today. I had 2 life left and my opponent had 13. I played [Day of Judgment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Day of Judgment) (Wrath of God except creatures can regenerate) Which killed my opponents 6 green token, 2 white flying token, 3 creatures, and my two flying 2/2s  
  
I played this card, [Terra Stomper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=186321), put a [Trusty Machete](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Trusty Machete) on him for a nice 10/9 creatures. Game Over. The game was pretty epic ended up drawing 1-1 with the guy.
posts.html:
I played a Zendikar tournament today. I had 2 life left and my opponent had 13. I played Day of Judgment (Wrath of God except creatures can regenerate) Which killed my opponents 6 green token, 2 white flying token, 3 creatures, and my two flying 2/2s

I played this card, Terra Stomper, put a Trusty Machete on him for a nice 10/9 creatures. Game Over. The game was pretty epic ended up drawing 1-1 with the guy.

Posted By: BinarySpike (9/26/2009 11:14:30 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Green already has crazy mana acceleration. So why does it continually get big creatures (with good abilities and no drawbacks) at reduced casting costs??? Add the fact that things like [Naturalize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Naturalize) (which is a stolen white card) and [Acidic Slime](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Acidic Slime) exist for removal, and it's just bogus! Why does wizards give everything to green?? And don't give me any of that "power pendulum swinging" \*\*\*! Share the love! When was the last time a mono red deck dominated the tournament scene? Green used to be my favorite color but nowadays I shy away from it just out of principle. It gets all the easy outs, WotC turned it into the teacher's pet of the color pie.... lamesauce!

posts.post_content:
Madformedusa, if you didn't notice, Naturalize doesn't remove creatures and Acidic slime is 5CMC and can be evaded or removed in regards to keeping creatures safe.  
  
Although I don't want to jump to conclusions, I tend to agree the anti-blue aspect of this card is pretty crazy. What could blue answer this with?  
  
EDIT: [Mindbreak Trap](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mindbreak Trap), evidently.
